diff_hunk:
@@ -560,20 +599,12 @@ def _maybe_sort_array_beams(self, t, parent_ids, sequence_length):
       return t
     shape = t._element_shape[0]
     # pylint: enable=protected-access
-    batch_size = tensor_util.constant_value(self._batch_size)
-    reshaped_shape = tensor_shape.TensorShape(
-        [batch_size, self._beam_width, None])
-    if (shape.ndims >= 1 and shape[0] == batch_size * self._beam_width
-        or shape.ndims >= 2

body: i think i prefer turning it into a warning (use tf_logging.warn) and hope that the user sees it when their session fails to run.  that's probably enough.  having unknown first dimension is more likely than a user using concat on a tensorarray; so we don't need to be too conservative here.
